notes.text:
An update for dpdk is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The dpdk packages provide the Data Plane Development Kit, which is a set of libraries and drivers for fast packet processing in the user space.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: dpdk (19.11.3). (BZ#1824905)

Security Fix(es):

* dpdk: librte_vhost Malicious guest could cause segfault by sending invalid Virtio descriptor (CVE-2020-10725)

* dpdk: librte_vhost Integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base() (CVE-2020-10722)

* dpdk: librte_vhost Integer truncation in vhost_user_check_and_alloc_queue_pair() (CVE-2020-10723)

* dpdk: librte_vhost VHOST_USER_GET_INFLIGHT_FD message flooding to result in a DoS (CVE-2020-10726)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in DPDK versions 18.05 and above. A missing check for an integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base() could result in a smaller memory map than requested, possibly allowing memory corruption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of Ceph as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for DPDK.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base()

notes.text: A memory corruption issue was found in DPDK versions 17.05 and above. This flaw is caused by an integer truncation on the index of a payload. Under certain circumstances, the index (a UInt) is copied and truncated into a uint16, which can lead to out of bound indexing and possible memory corruption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer truncation in vhost_user_check_and_alloc_queue_pair()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of Ceph as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for DPDK.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer truncation in vhost_user_check_and_alloc_queue_pair()

notes.text: A flaw was found in DPDK version 19.11 and above that allows a malicious guest to cause a segmentation fault of the vhost-user backend application running on the host, which could result in a loss of connectivity for the other guests running on that host. This is caused by a missing validity check of the descriptor address in the function `virtio_dev_rx_batch_packed()`.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost Malicious guest could cause segfault by sending invalid Virtio descriptor
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The versions of `dpdk` as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 were not affected by this flaw, as they did not include the vulnerable code, which was introduced in a later version of the package. This issue did not affect the versions of `ceph` as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for dpdk.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: dpdk: librte_vhost Malicious guest could cause segfault by sending invalid Virtio descriptor

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in DPDK versions 19.11 and above. A malicious container that has direct access to the vhost-user socket can keep sending VHOST_USER_GET_INFLIGHT_FD messages, causing a resource leak (file descriptors and virtual memory), which may result in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost VHOST_USER_GET_INFLIGHT_FD message flooding to result in a DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The versions of DPDK as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 were not affected by this flaw, as they did not include support for the inflight share memory feature, which was introduced in a later version of the package. This issue did not affect the versions of Ceph as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for DPDK.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
